1.text: I think a lot of people are surprised

3.text: thinking, "I didn't know you did that".

5.text: And then they say "Oh that's really really good" and "how long have you been

11.text: As long as I enjoy it

13.text: She's absolutely happy I go out and do what I do

16.text: I just thought, if I don't do it now, I never will

19.text: I thought this would be a way to, you know

22.text: fulfil my passion of what I wanted to do

24.text: and still be doing the catering.

26.text: What do I get out of it?

32.text: Could you hurry up please? Table 6 are waiting . .

34.text: Yeah, I've got a full time job - 40 hours plus per week

38.text: I do find time for the Specials because

42.text: I've been married for 27 years and I've got a 14 year old

45.text: so I manage my Special volunteering time around my family.

48.text: I feel like a child - especially when you're in the car and they put the blue lights on.

51.text: you're like 'Yes' come on I really wanna go

53.text: We need all sorts of people with all sorts of personalities.

56.text: I mean if we were all like me we'd all be driving each other nuts.

59.text: for me it's definitely another life because

61.text: some of the things that we do is amazing.

64.text: My mum said 'Oh - what about becoming a police officer?"

67.text: and I sort of laughed at her and I said

69.text: You're joking right? Look at me I like my hair, I like my nails

71.text: my make-up - I'm girly and she said

77.text: "Why don't you go along to it, have a look and see what it's all about."

80.text: We are Special constables who have the same powers as regular officers.

85.text: and we are committed to the job.

87.text: I'm proud of what I do and I am a serving officer.

92.text: We volunteer for the Essex Police Special Constabulary

95.text: Finding time within our busy lives to serve our communities and make a difference.

103.text: To find out how, visit our website
